text: Hi folks, new HS CMS developer here. I'm working with a local/sandbox version of my site and I'm trying to build out search and search results functionality. But for some reason, my search results page always shows no results no matter the term despite me having published a few sample website and blog pages to my sandbox environment. Has anyone experienced this before? I'm losing my mind trying to figure out why there are no results.

Hey <@U0301KVDYF3>! Are your sample website/blog pages no-indexed by any chance? That would prevent them from showing in search results.

If not, sharing one of your pages as an example might help.

Thanks for the reply <@U02NJACH5QS> â€“ the website pages are meta robots noindex'ed. The blog pages aren't (or shouldn't be, at least). Digging around some documentation, I can that there's a specific HubSpotContentSearchBot... So I'm suspecting then that having my pages set to noindex without allowing the HubSpot content search bot is part of my problem here?

Oh yeah I definitely had my robots.txt set to disallow all. I've updated to allow the HubSpotContentSearchBot. No immediate noticeable effect but holding out hope it might propagate through in the next couple of hours....
